word.description: {越} is short for [Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietnam) ({越南}), {式} is *style*), {炸} is *deep-fried*, {春} is *Spring*, and {卷} is *roll*, so 越式炸春卷 is *Vietnam-style deep-fried Spring roll*.

description: You may be familiar with [fresh Vietnamese spring rolls](https://delightfulplate.com/vietnamese-fresh-spring-rolls-goi-cuon/) (called *guo cuon* in Vietnamese) that are served cold and not-fried, but Vietnamese cuisine also has a [deep-fried spring roll](https://kake.dreamwidth.org/124605.html) (called {chả giò} in Vietnamese), visibly distinguished from the Chinese version by a bubbly skin made from rice paper.

word.description: {越南} is [Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietnam), {春} is *Spring*, and {卷} is *roll*, so 越南春卷 is *Vietnam Spring roll*.

description: [Vietnamese spring rolls](https://delightfulplate.com/vietnamese-fresh-spring-rolls-goi-cuon/), called *guo cuon* in Vietnamese and also known as *fresh spring rolls*, *summer rolls*, *salad rolls*, or *rice paper rolls*, are made with a thin rice paper wrapping and served cold, not fried.
